alert.note: Alert for East Slopes of the Northern Oregon Cascades; Lower Columbia Basin of Oregon (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 18 at 2:12PM PDT until August 18 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...GUSTY WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY THROUGH THIS EVENING... .It will continue to be windy with low RH`s this afternoon and evening. Wind speeds will be at least 15-25 mph with gusts to 35 mph, except 25-35 mph with gusts to 50 mph in the Kittitas Valley. These winds will combine with low RH`s to create Red Flag conditions. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES OR639, OR641, WA690, AND WA691... * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zones 639 East Slopes of the Northern Oregon Cascades, 641 Lower Columbia Basin of Oregon, 690 Kittitas Valley and 691 Lower Columbia Basin. * WINDS...West 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph, except 25 to 35 mph with gusts to 50 mph in the Kittitas Valley. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 11 percent. * IMPACTS...Winds and critically low humidity values will contribute to rapid fire spread and extreme fire behavior.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes of the Northern Oregon Cascades; Lower Columbia Basin of Oregon
